Despite it being a Saturday night and a packed restaurant, there was a short wait for a table.  The restaurant had tv's all around with a full bar that was swarming with people.  My friends and I sat in the middle of the restaurant and it was fairly loud.  We had to raises our voices to hear each other.  They have a small private party room in the back with doors that close.  Compared to their NYC locations (Midtown, Gramercy, and Chelsea), it's a much smaller restaurant.  The location was previously "Little Town" which is no longer there.  Ainsworth Hoboken is located right near the water and a short walk to the Path and NJ Transit, as well as it being close to the heart of other bars/restaurants in Hoboken.  My friends and I ordered the fish tacos and buffalo chicken tacos that were delicious!  The drinks were perfect and everything came out quickly.  Next time I'm going to try the mac and cheese burger.  Overall, delicious and affordable food.  I would go back again!

The burgers are the obvious go-to item -- and with good reason, they're inventive and delicious. But don't sleep on the rest of the menu either. The crispy crab tacos are out of this world (if I could buy a tub of the filling and take it home, I would), and the mac and cheese -- the same kind that's poured on top of their famous mac and cheeseburger -- is a must-have side. It's creamy and cheesy and oh-so-delicious. The Ainsworth manages to expertly walk the line between feeling like an upscale bar, and a local neighborhood pub. On any given day, you'll see families in the dining room and young singles in the bar area watching the game, and everyone's having a great time. The customer service is excellent, too.

I came here with a friend on a Monday and there were a good amount of people. Supposedly everything here is locally sourced.I got the fish sandwich which tasted like a McDonald's fillet-o-fish but slightly elevated. The bread was tasty and there was a good amount of fish but to me there was too much sauce. The sandwich was pretty big! The fries that came with it were surprisingly good.My friend got the fish tacos and she said they were good as well. It came with 3 tacos but they were relatively big as well.

Came here unexpected on A Wednesday Night , comfy service was Decent ! the drinks were excellent & water was puried ! food was tasteful !!! we definitely enjoyed our time there .. i will revisit & with different people for different opinions
Always fun coming here. Friendly staff, delicious food and drinks make the spot perfect!Always cool to stop by and have the best drinks in Hoboken by Natasha!

This place definitely needs a management change. It was clear that the marketing team was great. They hooked us in with a beautiful website, trendy offerings, gorgeous location. Unfortunately they oversold and undelivered on the product and service. Better prices then other Hoboken selections but the value for money is still lacking. Go down the street to any other restaurant instead.

Let me start by saying that I've had yelp for nearly two years now and had never felt compelled to write a review. I am not going to write a novel about my experience at Ainsworth. Rather, I'd like to share a few hints with the managment staff. 1. The hostess shouldn't be more interested in her text conversation than seating your customers. Particularly on opening week. 2. When there are paying customers who want to be seated... and there are seats available for them... Seat them! Believe it or not, people in Hoboken appreciate good service and aren't impressed when you make us wait outside. 3.  When the list of things you are "sold out of" accounts for 25% of the menu... Order more of those things. 4. I thought everybody knew this one but appetizers are supposed to come out BEFORE the meal. 5. If there are only 6 people at the bar and half of them are waiting on their check or another drink, that's a bad time for the bartenders (yes, there were 2 on shift) to leave the bar for 10 minutes. Check on the customers first. Amazingly bad.

A little overpriced for the burgers but they are pretty delicious. Felt service was trying to rush our party since we came in around 9-10 PM. They also have a pub bar which is somewhat awkwardly  & tightly placed towards the door & restaurant. If you are looking for a good meaty scrumptious burger with great giant fries, you can definitely find it for much less at another spot. It was ok, probably wouldn't be my first choice to visit next time.

Used to be Littleton and is basically the same burger and sandwich fare. Bacon cheeseburger $15 and chicken BLT on ciabatta $14. Totally worth it!!!Nice selection of beers and the service was excellent. Well done Maggie!!!Worth a stop. Have fun

The food and drinks may or may not be good here. It's not that I didn't have any, it's just that the terrible service overshadowed everything else. I don't know if they were understaffed or what but I really don't care. It was just bad. I won't be back and I definitely won't recommend it to anyone.

1. I'm super ecstatic about paying $13 for a "Crudite and Hummus Platter" and receiving 3 pieces of 4 kinds of vegetables with a minuscule sized serving of hummus accompanied with ranch and honey mustard.... Said no one ever. Why not just more hummus like the name implies?2. Our waitress focused more on some guy that was there while we were eating. She was nice but frequently absent. The place wasn't that crowded and it took forever to get our wine. I had been here for drinks before when it was way more populated and the service was a lot better. Not sure what to make of this.Most likely won't back to eat. Drink? Maybe.

The spinach dip and burgers are great, however the beef tacos, buffalo chicken tacos and fish tacos are awful. Save yourself dissapointment and do not order any of the tacos.I would not take someone to dinner here, definitely more of a drink/appetizer type place. Hoboken has so many other wonderful bars and restaurants with much better food to enjoy.

RUN. AWAY.I really hate to start a review with that negative comment, but I just can't help it. We had an awful, awful time here.I was really excited to try the Ainsworth--I had been to the 26th Street Ainsworth and had a great time. I was thrilled that the Ainsworth was setting up shop in Hoboken. So when my sister, brother-in-law, nephew, and cousins were in town, I thought it would be a great opportunity to give the Ainsworth a try.We made a reservation for 11am on Sunday, which was a great time for a group visit. The restaurant was pretty empty when we walked in, so we had room to spread out. All the staff were really nice and friendly. We were off to a good start.The trouble began when we ordered coffee. You'd think that coffee would be pretty easy to come by at brunch on a Sunday. When the already small cups came, they were half-full, which seemed weird. But nobody commented. A while later, after the three sips of coffee had been drunk, nobody came around for refills, so we asked for more coffee. It never arrived. After waiting patiently, and after seeing that no other patrons had coffee either, we asked again. Apparently one of the coffee makers was broken, there was some glitch, etc. I have no idea what it was or what happened, but you would think that breakfast coffee would be important enough for them to do something to fix it...or at least to communicate to diners what was happening before we had to ask.Our food took a ridiculously long time to come out, but when it did, it was fine. Not good. But fine. But my cousin's over-easy eggs were basically raw. She had to send them back to the kitchen and watch us while we ate our food. Now, I make a lot of eggs, and I know that over-easy eggs take about three minutes to make, so I'm not sure what took so long, but her food just never came out of the kitchen. We had all finished our meals at this point. My husband, who was extremely upset by all of these missteps by the Ainsworth, spoke to the manager, who assured us that her meal would be the "next one out of the kitchen." It wasn't. We saw plate after plate of food come out of the kitchen, but none of them were hers. After a heated second conversation with the manager, her meal finally arrived.To make up for these problems, the manager gave us half off our bill and a free round of mimosas, which was very nice of him. But honestly, I would have preferred to pay full price for a better experience. My last trip to Little Town, which was there before the Ainsworth moved in, was filled with similar problems. Apparently not much has changed. I might be back for a drink or two, but I will not return for a meal. Oh, and the cherry on top was that our waiter (who really was very nice), accidentally spilled the last mimosa all over my nephew's stroller. We didn't blame the waiter, but we couldn't help but laugh.Never again.

The only reason I'm giving this place a star was because the food was decent. Either way I asked for the dressing on the side of my salad and it still had dressing mixed in. I ordered with shrimp and they gave me 4 over cooked small shrimp. Fish tacos were decent. The service was downright HORRIBLE. Our waitress didn't know the specials and she came by twice to take our order and once the food was served she legit never came back. Wtf?! We waited forever for the check and had to grab another waiter to get it for us. So disorganized. Management needs to hire more people or no one will ever come here. Little town was awful and I thought this place would be better. Stay away.
We stop for lunch at Ainsworth  Hoboken and it was big dissapoited Basic food,  the chicken wings are disgusting! One star for the location.

Went for brunch  awed ultimate service we were the onl u people  in there  and  we never  saw waitress  after we set down, and the food was horrible, I had the bicuts and gravy ,it was grease stale bicuts and hard  boiled eggs

Slow service, high prices, and multiple issues make the Ainsworth a place I am definitely not returning to.  We visited for a small group dinner and waited almost 20 minutes just to be asked our drink order.  The drinks came after a very long wait and one of them was completely different than what was ordered.The biggest issue of the evening was that of the girls in our party ordered a burger with bacon, and when it arrived the bacon was raw.  This is a major health hazard and completely unacceptable under any circumstances, but especially at the prices that the Ainsworth is charging.  In both of the instances where something went wrong no one ever apologized.  We will certainly not be giving this restaurant any business in the future.

If I could give ZERO stars then I would, because that's all this place is worth! Seriously do not waste your time by coming here. Save yourselves from the aggravation of horrendous service. We came here two weeks ago for Sunday brunch. What should have been a simple easy thing turned into a nightmare.  The hostess was rude from the start with an attitude. Initially we were told 30 min wait, which was okay.  It took them over 2 hours to just seat us(party of 4).  Which I would understand if it was busy, but almost half the place was empty! So we were at the overpriced bar spending around $15 per drink and starving. Their reason for the delay was that the kitchen was backed up. But I just don't get how??? How can they be so disorganized and unprepared. Finally got seated, and still starving.  Didn't think it was possible but the service just continued to decline.  We had to ask for our water to be filled.  Couldn't find our waitress to place order, then plates weren't taken.  We initially did tell our waitress how long we waited and how unhappy we were.  Her response was "oh" that's it.  Food was okay, small portions.  Overall  experience was horrible.  Would never recommend anyone to come here.  How can a restaurant actually run like this??? The manager was just walking around carelessly like there were no issues. They need better management.

Giving 3 since this place is brand new.  Was a 2 star experience. Went with four others in need of some brunch on a sunny Sunday morning.We called prior to make sure there was space for five, and there was.  What the hostess failed to mention on the phone was that despite being listed on the website menu (and the actual menus themselves), they were not starting to serve brunch items until the following week.I understand you're a new spot, so the menu snafu is (kind of) understandable...but if you're lucky enough to catch would-be brunching customers before they head in, why wouldn't you mention there is no brunch to be had?  Seems like common sense.Sad we have to lunch it up, but forging ahead.  It is obvious that thought went into the plates/design.  Plates are slabs of wood resembling butchers cutting boards.  Fries are held in a cylindrical metal thingy.  Presentation is nice.  Food: Burgers were OK.  Meat could use some salt for sure.  The French Onion burger in particular became an unappetizing mess because the english muffin wasn't toasted well and couldn't stand up to the burger.  Soggy, unseasoned mush.  The fries were really good---but lukewarm at best...which was a let down.Lastly, I don't think an establishment that charges $14 per Bloody Mary should have servers wear tank tops so menus end up in their bare arm pits.  ... I mean, just sayin. :)

::Update::Management has reached out to me and has assured this was an isolated incident where they were unstaffed and not prepared for a Saturday night crowd.  Hope they can turn it around.This is NOT the place to be in Hoboken on a Saturday night!  I was with a group of 7 that was basically forgotten about all night.  Management had two waitresses running around like chickens without their heads covering about 25 tables.  The whole group was very disappointed having to wait countless minutes to put a drink order in as well as the long wait for our food.  I will say the skirt steak i ordered, when it finally arrived,  was cooked perfectly and was very tasty. Everyone else also enjoyed their meals.  I give this place 2 stars for the cook and the fact that management did the right thing by comping the whole meal after our terrible experience.  This place needs a real overhaul if they expect any repeat customers.
I come here often. They recently changed their menu but my favorites like the Mac and cheese burger are still there, thankfully. They also have some really good speciality drinks.
Nice setting Food was good but service was not.Waitress was borderline rude and food took forever to come.

It was empty when we came in yet it still took a while to have our order taken and the server was a bit rude. Food was mediocre. It's not expensive, but it's also not cheap... all in all, I don't see the point in going back unless it's for a happy hour (no food!)

I'd come here if I were craving their Mac and cheese burger. It was pretty good but not earth shattering. I also had the beef tacos while I was here--again, tasty but not anything super star. To their credit, the portions are pretty decent. Maggie (if I remember correctly) our waitress accidentally put in an order for chicken tacos instead of the beef we ordered but quickly remediated the problem. I know they're new so I'll cut them slack for the little blips. Like sending oyster forks after the oysters, aforementioned mix up with the tacos & the slow firing of the entrees. We sat for a good 20 mins post oysters to get the burger and the wrong tacos. The drinks were also decent. My rye based "brownstone" drink came with a cool square ice cube. The gun fizz was also refreshing. I'm sure they're going to get better with time.

I wanted to love this place since its location and views are unbeatable. The setup inside is very nice and the decor is fun. Unfortunately we found the food to be pretty mediocre. The Quinoa-Kale burger, one of the few veggie options, was overly fried which was a bummer. They are also very touchy about substitutions - we were told the chefs don't like customers to "mess with their vision" - which seemed odd at a bar that serves mostly burgers and sandwiches. I would come back for the view but likely not for the food.

A buddy and I stopped in for a drink and I stayed for a bite to eat... I kind of wish I hadn't.Decor: The exterior, and the interior, of this place is fine. There is nothing unique about it and, actually, I feel like there could be a bit better use of the interior space (there seem to be half walls in strange places that close off parts of what could be a nice open dining area). While I'm glad they got rid of the "arcade" from the Little Town NJ days, not much else changed. Now, don't get me wrong, the decor is nice (semi-fancy, very clean lines and immaculately kept), there just isn't anything unique about it.Bathroom: Clean and also well-kept.Staff: The bartender was nice, rather attentive, and quick with making/serving drinks. However, and I'll get to this in my next paragraph, he messed up my order.Food: We started with beers, of which they have a decent selection (including Summer Shandy! Yes!), and then I stayed for a bite to eat. The menu remains as frustrating as Little Town's: not many choices, that don't compliment each other well, and nothing that jumps out at you as a "gotta try it." I went with the shrimp tacos, which came as three tacos and that's it - no side. I also ordered the mac 'n cheese (the only side that seemed to make sense for shrimp tacos... and that's saying A LOT since these two items don't go together at all!). The bartender parroted back my order to me to confirm and then put it in the computer. After a semi-long wait (granted, they were busy) I received my tacos - which were cold (and overall not really that tasty) - and no mac 'n cheese. Having already been annoyed at the menu itself, and the cold tacos, I decided to cut my losses and not ask about the mac (just see if it showed up on the bill). Thankfully it did not, but it is still odd given that he repeated my order and then immediately put it into the computer...Value: The prices are fine. Nothing outrageous, about what you'd expect, but given the overall experience I feel like I paid too much.Seeing that things have not changed much from Little Town NJ, except that those AMAZING 10 spice Wings are no longer on the menu!, I won't be returning for another meal.

I am giving this restaurant 3 stars because of its surprisingly good burgers and location. The hostess had no personality. We had to wait 10 minutes (not bad) for a table outside. We went by the bar and grabbed a drink. The bartender was friendly and quick. Our waitress meant well but saw her only once when we ordered and when I finally caught her attention to get the check. I finished my drink half way through my meal and really wanted another one (The Roosevelt - good cocktail) but had to switch over to water because our waitress never checked in. I ordered the Mac and cheese burger and my boyfriend the black and blue burger - DELISH! we were extremely surprised how good these burgers were considering the service thus far was mediocre.

We went there to celebrate a couple of birthdays for happy hour. We were told by friends that they had a ton of happy hour specials...and they do - on Tuesday, and this was Thursday. But still, house wine and some beers were half price...so we settled in at a couple of bar tables. The bar tables were very wobbly and small, and when we ordered food the plates barely fit on the table. We didn't have good service - it was spotty, and sometimes we got 2-3 different waitresses asking at the same time if we need drinks, and sometimes no one at all. The menu was smaller than I expected, esp in regards to apps, which is all I wanted. I ordered a mac and cheese burger instead of an app. That's the only reason why I gave it two stars - the burger was fantastic! Highly recommend it...much better than I expected. The other food everyone ordered was OK - nothing fantastic. Finally, the music was loud, and the crowd was very mixed. I think this place needs to figure out what it is and what crowd they are catering to...and get the waitresses trained better. I won't go back anytime soon.

Loved this place !! View is great! Drinks are wonderful ! Tuna tartare toDie for! And big ups to the bartender Yvonne , made our time at Ainsworth a pleasure. I would say definitely go here for a fun time with your friends !!

I was recommended this place by a friend and didn't know what to expect, but the food was great and had a warm atmosphere. The service was amazing! Our server Martina was excellent and came to our table and made us feel welcomed.

Visiting Hoboken from Toronto and staying at the W hotel around the corner.. Stopped into Ainsworth to have a drink and ended up staying and ordering food.. The oysters were just as good as the service was!! Martina who served us was very attentive and made sure we were never wanting anything. We had a great experience and would definitely come back next time me and my girlfriend are back in Hoboken..

In a word.  Meh.On par with the bar food you see on Washington Street.  This place used to be Little Town (chain of Village Pourhouse bars/restaurants that you see in NYC).  I've been to Little Town which also was meh.  I'm guessing other people felt the same way as me since they rebranded the restaurant and moved their location to 1st street.  Honestly they didn't change the place much beside rebrand it and paint the walls.  Everything is still "locally sourced."I got the fish tacos which came in a cute little taco holder and covered in a slaw of some sort.  Nothing spectacular, I would not order again.  The fish was not fried which is usually what makes a fish taco good.I saw alot of people ordering burgers which looked massive, so maybe it was my fault that I ordered something non-traditionally bar food.

The service in this place is pathetic. Just walked in, not crowded; waited 10 min for the bartenders (who were texting) to notice us. Then we had to actually tell him to wipe the gross bar down in front of us. He hands us a drink menu and again disappears for 10 min without taking our drink order. Walked out - could die of thirst and hunger waiting for this clueless staff to get it together!Happy Memorial Day!

I never write reviews while I'm at an establishment but this is just bad. We came in with no reservations and were told there was a 40min wait for 4 people. We sat towards the back bar at an empty table while we waited. While sitting there these women were clearly concerned because they were scheduled to have a party there but no one knew anything about it. We ended up getting a table almost an hour a half after we walked in! Best part was I was staring at 3 tables that could of accommodated our party the whole time! We asked about them but we were told they were reserved....I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich. I basically could have gotten the same thing at Wendy's for less than half the price. Two stars for the decent Cabernet Sauvignon. Save time and go to Del Friscos down the street.

Our first time at the Ainsworth in Hoboken was awesome! Food was amazing. Highly recommend the hangar steak burger. Soo good. Service was great as well! Our server Lindsay was fantastic. She was very attentive and extremely friendly! We will absolutely be back!

So this is my first time going here and after reading the reviews of amazing food and horrible service, it was right! I was expecting a cute brunch that we booked reservations for at 1.... Go there at 12:50, then had us sit at a bar table.... FOR Brunch!? When we requested for an actual table, you know, to fit food on, it took another 20mins to find a table. As we sat down to a real table, we sat there for another 20mins till someone got our order.... And then maybe about 15 mins to give us water. It is a shame that the food is so good and amazing but the service sucks.Table next to us was also complaining about the service because we got served and they sat there before we did.... And the table on the left of us was literally about to walk out.

There is nothing better than having a delicious meal/cocktail with a great view of NYC. Ainsworth offers that along with a fun ambiance. My bartender, Chanel suggested the crispy artichokes, the Mac and Cheeseburger and a Royale cocktail. She was  on point with all.  Great stop on Sinatra Drive.

My friend and I were looking for places to eat in Hoboken, so I decided to find places on yelp. I ran across Ainsworth, and we decided to give it a try. As soon as we walked in, I felt some good vibes. Nice dim lighting, cool music, and friendly hostess. We sat down, I ordered a Bloody Mary, and looked at. Good selection or burgers! My friend and I both ordered the same burger (Forgot what it was called.) we were very impressed. The fries we really good and our server was really nice. Unfortunately, we came on a rainy day, so We couldn't enjoy the beautiful skyline. I'm from Texas, and next time I come into jersey I will definitely be back!

We have been here twice so far. Once for lunch and another time just for drinks at the bar. Though they prepared me the wrong meal (so I got to try more than one dish), the food was good as was the service. The bartender at the bar was very good and you could taste the beer before ordering a whole pint but most of the taps did not have beer in them! It was such a tease. There were all these different beer tap handles of various beer brands but they were just there for show only. Other patrons were joking about it to us while we kept asking for draft beers that they didn't stock. It was like out of the 12 taps they had, only 6 had any beer coming out of it. Hopefully that will change!

I previously wrote a review I need to retract. Ainsworth wasn't open at the hour they accepted my reservation so I was upset.  The ainsworth  staff made sure I was given a proper chance to come back and enjoy their food. Both Erica and Maggie my server were amazing and  so was my food. So thanks ainsworth. You proved me wrong and I hope to see you again very soon.

TERRIBLE SERVICE. Waited 20 min to get a table, and 20 min for a Bellini & 1 hour for a burger + fries! Wasted my time with a restaurant like this. I would've been better off grabbing a sandwich at Smash Burger. This restaurant is not equipped to handle the volume. Unacceptable and probably not the best choice to go to if you have an appointment to meet after lunch!

Great food and great service. We have been here for brunch and drinks a few times before but actually just tried it for dinner and we had an amazing time. The food is always great here and we were welcomed with attentive service from beginning to end. The place was packed on a Thursday and everything seemed to be running smoothly. We will definitely be back for brunch again sometime soon and have found a new favorite dinner spot. Highly recommend Ainsworth for a fantastic meal.

Steady spot.  I'm not a huge fan of downtown Hoboken (unless we're talking Sunday football) and I thought they did a nice job on the update of this space.  I've been here once on a weekend night and once for weekday happy hour.  Points for the Moscow mule and Tuesday night taco special.

This place sucks.  I rarely leave bad reviews, But I honestly don't know how they afford the rent- the bartenders are rude and bad at pouring drinks, and the place is empty on a Friday night.  I am Looking forward to the place that replaces this soon-to-be-forgotten outpost of a great NYC bar(s). Thanks ainsworth for embarrassing Hoboken.
Apparently leaving Manhattan has its trade-offs. I just tried to use my AMEX and this place does NOT take American Express. Am I in a bodega or an Ainsworth? You be the judge.
My group tried about half of the burger offerings, all left satisfied. Juicy without being greasy. Service was prompt, and the cocktails were decently liberal.    I would return.
Food was great but the service is AWFUL. We were there for two hours and only got a burger. It took forever to get the waitress to even check on our table never mind take our order.

The weather is finally getting nice out so my boyfriend and I decided to try the Ainsworth for a drink as they have outdoor seating right along the water. There were no tables open however they had two stools at the "outdoor bar" (there is a window that allows the bar to service outside customers but the bar is on the inside). We had 2 friends coming so we were eyeing tables to open up outside - one opened up but it was only a two top and we asked the hostess if she could take another table and push them together (there was plenty of room for her to do this). She said she couldn't because the tables have different waitresses so it would the table away from the waitress. Our friends came and wanted to sit at the bar so we asked for more stools. Unfortunately we were not allowed to take stools from the inside and bring them outside because they are "designated inside stools" for customers that weren't even there. There was a tub with bottles of water that was sitting on stool for outside tables and we asked to use that stool and they said no its for the water (because water needs a stool too). Finally a table opened up so we asked to transfer our tab from the bar to the table. Well... it was basically asking to do brain surgery as no one could figure out that we moved about 4 feet from the bar to the table. I ordered a drink at the table which never came, the waitress completely ignored us. It is probably one of the most unaccommodating restaurants I've ever been to. The food is nothing special either. There are way better bars in Hoboken to go to. Do not waste your time getting side eyed from the hostess.

Respectable cocktails...Had the Sweet Ginger...kind of a mint julep with Prosecco, but not overly minty, or anything.  The Sangria def needed some fruit and some heft to it,maybe a jigger of Triple Sec or something to up that fruit, perhaps a shot of Saint Germaine in it would have created a much better finish. It was just cold, red wine, as it stood.The hangar steak burger was shredded hangar steak on a toasted bun, very good, a bit salty, and God I hope it wasn't loaded with MSG because I feel like I'm pretty revved up here tonight, and that's what MSG does...Makes things salty, tender, and leaves you feeling like a caffeine freak.  The fries, I gotta say, were THE BEST...When I asked for them well done, they came out CRRRUNCHY, not greasy, mushy or white... perfection...which is virtually impossible to find in Hoboken, other than at the new French bistro at the end of 1st Street, or Augustino's, and who can get in there?Service was very friendly, but pokey. The tables were arranged in a cafeteria, grid style,like eating in the bar-restaurant in Heathrow airport, if you've ever ventured back there..dark, very green, kind of like an old movie set, pre-Seinfeld. Lots of TVs, which was fine, and sort of expected in Hoboken.  Lots of b-ball games, golf, etc. Better than watching cricket at Pilsner, though Pilsner at night is gorgeous, all candle lit, with almost no electric lights.  Ainsworth could use a few less. Atmosphere.It lacks atmosphere.  Fewer lights might change the mood. Maybe the grid seating was modeling itself after the back streets of Hoboken, wasmy other thought.  Not too inspiring...Whats great about that?  Needs some loosening up, fewer tables, lighter colors,  maybe some fresh flowers to offset the green. Something more serene.  Most of ussit in offices all day and this place looks like "The Office" chain of restaurants.

I always end up coming here for drinks with my friends, but recently we came here for brunch. Their brunch menu is pretty good with a large variety. I had a burger which was massive! My friends loved everything they ordered as well. My only complaint was it was so hot inside we had to leave to drink somewhere else. We couldn't take it anymore!
very cool atmosphere. the place is fairly dark so makes for a nice date night. You can hang out by the bar see the nyc view and many faces just hanging out having a drink

What a great surprise. I've always wondered why the places along the Hoboken waterfront haven't had even greater success. It doesn't get much better in terms of location and view than Sinatra Drive. Ainsworth looks like a keeper. I took the comfort food route when I ate here on Sunday night. I enjoyed a few draft beers, some flash fried peppers, and a very tasty French Onion burger. The fact that burger was served on an oversized English muffin didn't hurt. As far as bar food goes...A+. Speaking of A+....the bartender was very nice as well. She took great care of us. I believe her name was Vicki...definitely give this place a whirl.

so happy with this place!  they were able to accommodate my large party of 15 last minute after things fell through at another restaurant.  the server was so sweet and the food was so delicious. definitely recommend it for brunch!

Just had brunch here (a Sunday), with 3 friends, I did not pick the place.  Food is mediocre, average, and overpriced.  $14 for Traditional Breakfast aka 2 eggs your way, ham or bacon, buttermilk biscuit, potatoes, also served with a few mixed lettuce leaves (think the 50/50 blend from the bag).  Small portion size and food was not hot when it came out.  No drink specials with brunch.  Service was slow.  Ambience is the only thing going for this place.  I imagine there are much better places in Hoboken for brunch.  I would not go back.

I recently enjoyed dinner last Saturday night at the Ainsworth. The cocktails were awesome, as was the service...thanks Emily! For dinner I had the shrimp skewers with a side salad, I was expecting less shrimp so I was really excited to see three full skewers in front of me. My date enjoyed the steak, which tasted great and was cooked to perfection. They had a DJ playing music pretty early (8:30 ish), so it was a little loud for dinner conversation, but I liked his song choices. They have a lot of TVs so I'm sure it's great for when football is on! The restaurant is right on the water and has a great vibe, if you're in Hoboken I would absolutely recommend this place!

Came here with my parents and brother for an early dinner on a Sunday.  The music was a little loud but they seemed to lower it as the night went on.  We each tried a different burger and everyone enjoyed their meal.  I have been here a few times and the burgers are always cooked perfectly and the fries are always on point!  I wished they had more options for their appetizers, but definitely a solid choice for dinner.
Mac and cheese burger - A+Bartender John (Red) - A+Feels more like Manhattan than Hoboken.  Will be returning.
Great food with awesome views.  Eat outside and enjoy some fresh air.  Great beer selection too.  We used a private room and they accommodated us with ease.

Poor service, generic decor and people. Very "basic." Wanted to go before we were even seated. Too many options to try this place again. If you're 23 and/or living that frat life, you'll love it. If you have any sense of personality and taste, you won't

Mac & cheese burger is the best burger I've ever had. It's huge so I always end up taking some of it home. Drinks are good and great location right by the water. The only downside is the cleanliness of the bathrooms...they are always a mess.

I went to Ainsworth with my girlfriend after spending the morning at the pier downtown and decided to grab a bite at the outside bar. After looking at the menu I chose the breakfast burrito and my girlfriend got the tuna tartare. The tuna tartare was pretty good but the breakfast burrito was small, came with no sides and was overall subpar. For $13 I would have expected a solid burrito with at least one side. We had a couple drinks which were average and our lunch turned into a nearly $100 affair. Highway robbery for what we received. The service was fine but overall we felt cheated by the food and drinks. The view was extremely nice, but there are many other places with just as good of a view on both sides of the Hudson. We ate dinner later that night in the west village and had an amazing meal for a significant discount compared to Ainsworth. Next time avoid Ainsworth and get the real deal for an appropriate price.

Very good food. Usually come here for lunch on Weekdays when ìts least crowded. Recommended the place to my boss and team for Christmas lunch with visitors. Everyone had a great time and enjoyed the food. Don't know the servers name but she provided great service consistent with my daily server Natalya. Highly recommend. Only four stats because i have yet to cone here when ìts crowded.
My favorite bar/restaurant for a Tuesday night! The trivia my doug is witty and hilarious. We had three best night. And the TACOS OH THE TACOS!!!

Myself and my family came in here for Christmas Eve dinner. We had requested the private room as we had a party of 8-10 people coming. They called us back to request that we come in earlier on Christmas Eve (assuming that they wanted to close earlier) we happily obliged. Our reservation was now at 530. We had an 11 month old with us and arrived 8 minutes late. We were greeted by the rudest hostess I have ever come across who tells me that she cancelled our reservation because we were 45 minutes late...surprising since we kindly came in earlier to accommodate the restaurant and were in fact 8 minutes passed 530pm. She seats us in the main dining room, when I mentioned that we had requested the private room she said you can't sit there because of a leak...we happily obliged again. She stomped off to chit chat with the bar tender and ignored us completely. We waited and waited for a server. We finally ordered and unfortunately what arrived to the table was luke warm mediocre food, my roast chicken was so salty it was inedible. I passed by the private dining room on the way to the bathroom and found that there was no leak at all just a room completely cluttered with Christmas decorations. We would have happily sat in the main dining room there was no need to lie. Overall this was a horrible Christmas Eve experience and I will never be coming back to this place again!

Came here for a late dinner one night. First off, our server Maggie was excellent. Very knowledgeable of the menu and gave us a great tip on our beers. Artichoke dip was delicious. The marinated skirt steak was not only cooked perfectly, but was also seasoned just right. For a busy night, the entire staff was very attentive to us. Great food. Great service. Will definitely be back.

This place has a major service problem. The wait for food is crazy long, waitresses disappear or quickly walk through the dinning room avoiding the eyes of customers. Whenever there's bad service at a restaurant, my first thought it that the place is understaffed. If the waitstaff is clearly overwhelmed, I understand slow service. When there are four or five waitresses milling around and chatting with each other rather than getting my bill...well, I'm done. Last time I was here, I had to go up to a group of waitresses to ask for my bill, after having waited for 20-30 minutes. Seriously, who hires and trains these people? Food is expensive and slightly below expectations (as in, good enough, but not worth the markup).

Came here on a Sunday afternoon with two others even though the reviews on here aren't that great. We went around 2 in the afternoon and the restaurant was steady but I wouldn't describe it as busy. We were seated immediately due to the many open tables yet our order wasn't taken for a solid thirty minutes, even though we asked TWICE for our waitress. After our waitress eventually came over her response was "sorry no one told me I got seated" Shortly after us the table next to us was seated, served, and left before we even had our food. The food took forever to get to us and even though it was good, wasn't worth the wait or the price. If i'm going to be paying almost $20 for a burger I would like to not have to wait for over an hour on a non-busy day to receive it. After eating we had to wait another half hour for our check? When we got our check it was wrong, there was other people's food items on it which took another fifteen minutes to get fixed. When she came back to give us the right check we were throwing our credit cards at her praying we would be able to get out of there soon. Throughout the entire time we were there I never saw our waitress serve a table around us, she was constantly missing and lacked attention. The entire experience was just a big long wait. The food was delicious and if it wasn't for the awful service I would have liked to go back but i'm not willing to have to dine for almost three hours for a hamburger. Due to the horrible service, I would not recommend this place to anyone which is unfortunate because the food was pretty decent, not worth the wait in the slightest. I would hate to go here at a busy time.

Great location, vibe, and service. I had hosted my friends bridal shower here on a Thursday night since she lives in Hoboken and our guests can easily walk from the path. We had a group of 10 girls and we were able to book their private little area in the back. The room was perfect for our size and more. We were able to have our privacy for the bridal shower games. From start to finish the service was amazing. Jen was very attentive and made sure our group had a great time. The food was really good. We ordered the pretzel crusted chicken fingers as an app and it was OMG delicious. The burgers were unique and amazing as well especially the Mac and cheese burger. Overall all the girls had an amazing time and thought the service was great. We would definitely host another party here again.

I wanted to like this place, it has a nice location. I was hoping that some formidable establishment and management team would take over the space Little Town once occupied until it fell flat on its face. Basically you have the same problems now as you did before. I showed up the first week it was open for lunch and was told the wait was 40 minutes and there were about 40 tables available. I think this was a "hype move" to make it seem like this place was so popular it was worth the wait. It isn't. My girlfriend went to this place last Saturday for drinks with her friends to watch the derby and they ordered another round as the horses crossed the finish line and they were told that they wouldn't serve them that they were to exit, pay the cover for the fight which was at 11:30 and they would re seat them but they had to close out. Ridiculous.  My friend and his girlfriend came last week for lunch and drinks, waited for 20 minutes for ANY service whatsoever to no avail and then finally left. The food is pretty good so that's why they are getting 1 star. That and Yelp won't let me give them negative stars. The final straw was I came back to give it one last chance on a weekday for a drink.  The restaurant had maybe 10 people in it. I was the only one at the bar and I witnessed a couple sit down at the bar, they were given menus, and after 10 minutes of no one coming back they left as they should. I've never given a place more chances than this one and they continue to disappoint.There are many other great places to bring your money, don't give it away here for nothing in return. @ management.. The pretty view won't keep you in business if you run an establishment like this. You'll have to buy the Farside and relocate this to a dive like you did Little Town.

Ainsworthless is more like it.  I purchased a living social deal for 18 oysters and 2 draft beers for Little Town (previously at this location) in Oct 2014 which was valid until Feb 2015.  I read in (201) magazine in January that Little Town was closed for renovations.  I called the restaurant and spoke with someone I assumed was the manager.  I explained that I had the coupon and didn't know they were closing and didn't get to use it.  he ASSURED me I could use it there when they reopened.  I also called living social and let them know what happened.  they also called and confirmed with the restaurant I could use it. I finally went there on 7/5 and it is now called Ainsworth.  the hostess didn't think we could use the coupon and got the manager John.  he said he would not honor my deal.  I said I called and was told yes at the beginning of the year.  he again said no because oysters are $3 each and it would cost him too much to honor my deal.  I asked him how that was my problem and said the owners shouldn't put offers online they can't honor.  (I can't confirm this because no pricing is provided online for raw bar items).  I was furious but he wouldn't budge.  he offered us drinks and an app on the house which I flatly refused.  if we had ordered the most expensive app ($19) and 2 whiskies ($22) it would have cost him $41 so why not just honor my coupon?  had he done the right thing we would have definitely stayed for lunch and he would have made all his money back and then some.it's terrible customer service like this that will no doubt be the demise of this place.  I read other online reviews and most said terrible service.  in a competitive market like Hoboken filled with hipsters they should be bending over backwards to ensure customers come back.  unfortunately when they close they won't have a clue why they weren't successful.

First of all the burgers are great, and served with an interesting flair (knife stuck through).  And after being here half a dozen times it's probably the only thing worth ordering. I tried a lighter fare, specifically the quinoa salad entrée tonight, and the $3 pile of cold quinoa that came out was not only extremely small but very disappointing... basically not a "salad" by any means, and the size of a side dish.  Our waitress was great, but waited a little too long for replacement drinks (10 minutes).  I want to like this place.  I hope it improves.

This place is a joke. I literally have nothing good to say. Went to Little Town a few times for multiple reasons (events, birthdays, etc.) and each time it was *bad*.. The first time at Little Town my girlfriend got horrible food poisoning. In addition, they couldn't keep the place AC controlled (I remember seeing the thermostat at 80+ degrees), the bathrooms were always broken and had a bathroom attendant (I mean, how douchey can you get), half the taps didn't work, and place was in general disarray even though it was only one a year to two years tops?Why all the comments about Little Town, you ask? Well I assumed, if they were going to pull back, reset, and start fresh with Ainsworth, I figured they'd get their food, facilities, service, management, together... I am in disbelief. These people are incapable of managing a restaurant. Our friends were holding a birthday last night so we decided to give it yet another chance with a clean slate, and have dinner beforehand. Service was horrendous-- our waitress would take 20-30 minutes before she even checked in-- she walked by us about 10 times ignoring us. It was clear no one had  a clue what they were doing. We both got a burger.. Mine medium, hers  medium rare. Her burger came back raw. No exaggeration, I was afraid she would get sick if she ate it-- dark red. I  had to flag down a bus boy for them to heat it up since our waitress was nowhere to be found. Overall the food was super greasy and unimpressive. I know i come off as a complainer with th is review, but I'm just not that person. I always try to give the benefit of the doubt but this place and management has just let us down too many times. Bill was pricey at over 75 bucks, too.After our meal, it was time for the birthday event that was scheduled and  reserved in advance for apparently 30+ people. They clearly had  no plan to accommodate us and put us in a corner with no room at all; everyone was  clearly pissed off and shocked at this... It's not like we came in without a  reservation or heads up. Then, they moved us to a different booth after about 20 minutes.. Not much better. Again I get that it's two weeks into opening and they were crowded but they should have told them they couldn't accomodate that big of a party. No one was pleased and we left shortly after the "surprise" entrance. Last but not least, the bathroom had a broken urinal (they couldn't fix this sh*t after two years and a new grand opening?) and a bathroom attendant which is just awkward and everyone hates. This isn't the W. When it filled up later in the night I was sweating yet again because they're incapable of increasing the AC.I Will be adding this bar / restaurant to the "places I will never ever go to" list in Hoboken. This list only has one other place, 1 Republik. If you like shit service, crowded cramped layout, average at best  food w a chance  of food poisoning, and to hang out with a bunch of douchebag bros, this is your spot. Unbelievable how inept these people are at running a restaurant. Doesn't matter I guess, people will still go because of the housewives owners and its vicinity to the PATH and Hudson River. The five star reviews are clearly friends and family.. Expect the overall rating to drop significantly very quickly.

Have been here once. Food was very good, but pricey for what you get. Never drink specials. They do have really creative cocktails (try the rosemary one). Given the choice Id probably go somewhere else... Cheaper and pretty much the same food.

Food good: 7.5, service -12.3Every time I've been here we get seated and the waiter never comes.  What gives? Staff is friendly but when my appetizer comes out with my main course that is pretty annoying.     This place is damned empty too as I write this.

My first yelp review because after my experience here I have never been so frustrated. If it had just been the extremely slow service and just OK food I probably wouldn't be writing this, I get it places have their bad days. We split the bill between two cards and I noticed a few days later my card was charge d the full amount and my boyfriend was charged his half. I called and they told me manager wasnt there and to call back. Called back and manager wasn't available and took my name and number but no call back. Called again and a girl took my information and was going to look into it. Get an email that they "can't find" my transaction and if I could give them a list of what I had... a week later and still has not been resolved.AWFUL customer service, definitly will not be back.

We have come here many times and usually love it. The skirt steak with the chorizo hash is awesome,  but last night everything kind of sucked. We ordered the Italian skewer and it came to our table still raw in the middle. When we told the waitress that it is raw, she said "oh, you want it cooked all the way through? "Of course !it's pork! Do you want us to get tape worm lol. Your servers and cooks should know this about pork. So she took it back and literally they just put the same plate on the grill and brought it back to us. It should have been brand new and fresh. Not a re fry.  Them the steal we ordered medium rare was under cooked lol. Get it together!

Came for opening night and was disappointed. It looks and feels exactly like Littletown. The bartender was obnoxious and unfriendly. I asked for a titos and soda and she replies "no titos". She couldnt suggest another vodka they did have? Same response when I asked for an alagash. Threw the check at my boyfriend. This crappy attitude is the reason I stopped going to Littletown. There are too many other options in Hoboken where the bartenders actually say hey how are you and make you feel welcome, so I don't need to keep giving this spot another chance. Train your staff better and maybe you'll get people to come back.

I came on a Monday night and didn't even get to eat because the service was so terrible. The restaurant was not crowded at all and yet we waited ten minutes to be seated when many tables were open. Once we were seated, we waited over 15 minutes for someone to come take our order or even speak to us so we got up left. If this restaurant wants to survive in Hoboken, the service needs to be much better.

I'm sitting here with my friends as we speak and we ordered a hummus platter. This is not a platter by definition. It came in a measly portion -literally the mini teeny tiny dish that ketchup is served in. This isn't even an appetizer - I would be embarrassed to serve this !! Never again ! I will say however that my friends said their steak was phenomenal. Oh and the fruit tart was delicious. But they still got one star for the despicable appetizer.

This spot is cool because it's near the water and they keep the windows open so it feels very open. Besides that I didn't think that the food or drinks were anything special. The service was good so I'd be back for a quick drink but wasn't blown away

Came here on a Friday night and it was packed which I don't mind at all. Our server was great. I have no complaints about her. I ordered the Mac and cheese burger and OMG IT WAS SO DELICIOUS. I keep thinking about it. I am going to be returning soon.

This place has a really nice interior and nyc skyline view if you are sitting near the entrance by the bar or outside. Also, this place has some tasty burgers and some nice brews on tap. A bit pricey but def worth it!

Tried it once. Tried it twice. Never again .They tried to make up for a bad experience by giving a free bottle of champagne and appetizer. We were so pleased to see that this cute little bar was going to make up for its bad first impression. But to our disappointment the service was not great and the food while ok was incredibly slow!! The whole place was not busy at all, a lot of open tables and plenty of staff. The one appetizer, the tuna tar tar, took 30 minutes to come out! Then from the time we places our food (a little while after we ordered the app) tool 45 minutes to come out!   For dinner we ordered sandwiches and one person in our group asked to order a piece of grilled chicken and a side of broccoli (due to allergies and diet). Both items were placed somewhere in the menu so she just asked if she  put them together. The waitress said she wasn't sure if she could do that but would ask.  She came back a few minutes later and said it could not be done. This person asked if there was a way to substitute something and make it possible. The waitress said no.  Fifteen minutes later the waitress came back and said she could do it. So we said thank you.  We waited way too long for our food, for it just to be ok. Staff was standing around talking, no one came over to check or apologize for the wait.  I am really disappointed in this place. I will never be going back.

Walking up on a beautiful Wednesday night, and we see there's at least 5 tables available outside. I ask the hostess to seat us (2 people) outside.  She says there's no available tables and I ask about the empty ones.  With a HUGE attitude, she tells us there's a wait for those.  Meanwhile there is NO ONE standing there being led to those tables.  I ask what the wait time is, she informs us she has no clue.  So between her inexperience, carelessness, and attitude, my boyfriend and I settled with sitting inside since she said she could seat us right away.  Then she leads us to the back of the restaurant, where there's no one sitting, no lights on, and an empty bar, to seat us.   We had to ask to sit at a table in the main part of the restaurant, which is annoying.  Then, our waitress took 10 minutes to get us water, finally took our drink and dinner orders.  My boyfriend ordered a beer and I thought I would try a signature drink (assuming signature drinks would taste good).  His beer was warm, my drink (an eighteen 88) was AWFUL, comparable to a drink made by a college freshman by mixing crystal light, water, and vodka. Our food came out quick, which is why I'm giving it a single star.  However, the burgers that came out had a ring of grease around them.  The grease soaked into the buns! Fries were mediocre, and everything seemed to have way to much salt involved.  I hope it gets better, but it is not likely that I'll ever find out.  With so many restaurants in Hoboken, I won't be back to this one. Pros- good wait staff, food served quickly Cons- awful hostess, bad food, bad drinks, warm beer

Had wanted to try the restaurant for a while. My wife and I went for lunch on Sunday. Overall we had a good experience. The service was a bit slow to start which was a bit disappointing considering the restaurant wasn't the that busy. The food was good. My only  complaint was the portions were lame. I ordered the blackened Mahi and got a very small piece of fish. My wife had a burger and enjoyed it.

This is the classic 'every time I go there I have a problem' place. The food's not bad, although I have had to send things back when they were prepared incorrectly. The drinks are usually poorly made and I have never had a positive experience with service. No one is rude, it just seems like they are seriously lacking training. I gave them a few tries and have consistently been unimpressed. The best part is that they are located by the water.

I really enjoyed the venue, service and level of interaction at Ainsworth. Not only will I be dining again from here but my friends loved the place as well! Ainsworth really shows the rest of Hoboken the kind of service and speed that bar-restaurant areas require.By the way, the tuna tartare is delicious!

Came for drinks for opening night , it was ok. Don't call yourself a "gastropub with craft cocktails" if you can't even add vodka to a vodka soda. Paid $9 for water. Changed to a Pinot grigio - I'm not a wine snob and am not the type to ever send a drink back, but for another $9, this crap wasn't drinkable. Tasted like it had either been open for a month or the whole bottle cost $3. I'm talking worse than Barefoot. Didn't order a cocktail and after that experience wouldn't have, so can't speak for those of food. I give the 3 stars because the waitress was really nice and upgraded my wine to a decent wine (but couldn't I have had that the first time?) , and because the space was really nice. A little disappointed but understand it was their first day. Love the Ainsworth in the city but this doesn't hold up, at least not yet.

Great location with above decent food but not great - certain things overpriced but for the most part fairly priced - service was good but I asked for my bun toasted and was told no changes can be made - so I asked the waitress to see if it comes already toasted and she asked the chef who said yes it is - of course it comes out not toasted- If it was toasted the burger would have no complaints - the fries were not good - other people in the party had fish tacos and skirt steak and said it was good

THIS PLACE IS MOST DEFINITELY A PLUS IN MY BOOK!  My fiance and I decided to eat here on July 4th, we feel in love with this restaurant, and highly recommend it to any one in the area.  Not only were the food and drinks AAAAMAAAAZING, the atmosphere, ambiance, location, and service were a huge hit in my book.  The staff were super friendly and accomidating to my needs.  If you are looking for a place to eat, with a beautiful view of the NYC Skyline, amazing food, spectacular drinks, and great staff, Ainsworth in Hoboken is the place to go!!!

My wife and I came here for lunch on a Thursday.  It was empty. When you walk towards the restaurant there is an inside/outside bar that opens to view NYC.  Atmosphere is trendy inside.Service was above average.Buffalo Chicken tacos were good and had a kick.  Shrimp tacos were below average.A side of fries was $7.  Overall overpriced.

My reviews based on a Tuesday night experience. After reading a lot of bad reviews, I was very hesitant to try this place out especially because I hated everything about it's predecessor Little Town. I never bothered to review Little Town because the food, service and overall experience could only be described as crap. Anyway, back to Ainsworth... They didn't change the interior too much but just enough to make it look less divey. For a Tuesday night, it appeared they had a decent amount of people. Looked more like a date night crowd. Our server was very sweet and bubbly. Knowledgeable of the menu and helpful with suggestions. My only issue and this is maybe me just being a woman but the uniforms look cheap and dont match the new decor. The tight tank and tighter black pants just didnt fit the new vibe of this restaurant. Maybe save that for the late night weekend crowd. As far as the important stuff goes, food & drink, I was pleasantly surprised. I tried their cocktail the crooked knife which is jalapeno infused Avion tequila, lemon juice and agave garnished with a red chili pepper. I could only have one but this was a great cocktail. Beware of that first sip though I almost spit fire. For an app we got the tuna tartare which was very fresh and flavorful. For dinner,  I got the fish tacos they were 3 nicely proportioned soft tacos with generous portions of blackened fish, mango salsa and slaw. My friends got salads, the thai kale and a chicken caesar, they both enjoyed. My one friend didnt like the kale in the caesar but other than that no complaints. We also split the cauliflower, broccoli fried egg side dish which was interesting but tasty none the less. I would definitely be interested to try Ainsworth out again on a weekend dinner or brunch to see if there's a big difference in service and food quality.

It sucks when the food is decent and the service blows. We did wait 20 min for our food but it was pretty good. Unfortunately the service here blows. The waitresses and hostesses look pretty but don't do shit and seem pretty clueless. The manager also looks very over dressed and pretty but almost walked into me and didn't apologize or say a word. I will probably come back cause the location is great and food isnt bad but eesh.

I had dinner here the other night. The food was great, the atmosphere was nice. I definitely recommend the patio which overlooks the NY skyline / waterfront. The breeze and warm summer night, combined with the food and drink made everything that much better!

The interior is Little Town with more TVs and no Foosball.  Not a good spot to watch games - the bar area is tiny and cramped. Since it is brand new I will give the server and hosts a pass. The food was good. Grilled Chicken BLT is solid.We came on a Saturday during March Madness the tables were empty but the host was reluctant to seat us because they were "totally sold out with reservations". After bartering for a table to order some food at they finally sat us. Our waitress seemed very overwhelmed and stressed even though we were her only table. After we asked for the check we were rushed to get up because the host had a reservation for the table. We got up and hung out at the bar. No one was seated at the table for at least another hour.

Came here about 3 weeks back and it was amazing!!! We started with the oysters that were fresh then had a spinach and artichoke dip which was also amazing. I then went into a Mac and cheese burger which was out of this world!!!! They are pet friendly which is also a plus ! Deff will go back

If I could give this place less than one star, I would. My friends and I were just there for lunch and one bite into my burger, I see a mouse by my feet! I immediately drop my food and put my legs up, as did my friends. It took about 5 minutes for someone to even come ask why we were standing on our chairs. When we told them about the mouse, no one seemed surprised! Several of them laughed. Our waitress didn't apologize. A busboy joked, "don't worry the pet snake will get it." The manager comes over and barely apologizes and quickly walks away. Our burgers get taken away (each only one bite in) and our bill comes. They charged us for everything! So I called the manager back and demanded that she remove our uneaten burgers from our bill. She says, "I didn't realize you hadn't finished eating" as if that makes it okay to charge us for this horrifying experience. Our bill comes back and we are still charged for our 2 beers and order of wings. We quickly pay and get up to leave and the busboy comes back around again and laughs, points at the floor and jokingly yells "watch out, watch out" as we are leaving. Extremely confused by this whole experience.

We had dinner here for a birthday and there was a lot of us, ainsworth was able to accommodate us and that was nice service was ok. However the food was just ok nothing was spectacular.  Mac and cheese hamburger was less then impressive and my salad was dry and drab

Listed "wild salmon" on the menu but it was definitely farmed (color and taste clearly farmed).  I complained to the waitstaff who did not answer my question.  Finally I went directly to the kitchen and they admitted it was farmed.  Do not trust these guys.

This gives the NYC Ainsworth locations a bad name!What a letdown. I wasn't a fan of Little Town, but really like The Ainsworth in the city so I was hopeful. Only two redeeming qualities about this location - it was pretty inside and the fries were good. :)Two of us were there on a Sunday; the restaurant was about 1/3 full. It took forever to get a server and we noticed three other tables had to continuously flag down someone to ask for a server. I wonder if the hostess doesn't tell servers once they have a table or if there are no sections? The waiter, busboy, etc. were all very nice, but just not good service - a long wait for everything. We got the crudite to start, which was nothing special and then each got sandwiches. I didn't think the food was very good at all - everything was very blah. The drinks were unfortunately really overpriced too. :(

Went on a Saturday evening for dinner.  Was seated promptly and the atmosphere is very hip and trendy.  Ordered the bang bang burger and my wife ordered the mac & cheese burger.  The burgers get an A for their composition.  The burger meat and bun are both average, but when you add all of the other ingredients you get a very good burger.  The only reason that this place isn't getting 5 stars is that our server was very slow and pretty much vanished after our food came out.  We shouldn't have to hunt you down to get refills on our drinks or to pay the check.  I'd be interested to try their dessert when they release the dessert menu.  Hopefully next time the servers are more attentive.

I was pretty excited to see Ainsworth come to NJ since I've always been a fan of their NYC location but I really don't see much difference between this and Little Town. They put some money into some re-decoration to make the place a little darker and give it a more sophisticated vibe as well as added TVs for the sports experience it's known for in the city but something is missing. I put this in the category of Victor Hotel Bar, a place I want to like a lot more than I do, but can't.

We accidentally bumped into this place thinking its one of the several bars n restaurants in the area.. But we were in for a total surprise! We ordered quinoa n kale burger, one of the best burgers i have had in sometime! Asparagus skewers and buffalo cauliflower were equally good and they way they served these added to the touch.. Definitely recommended..

i think this is the worst restaurant experience i've ever had. what makes it the worst was because not only was the the food subpar for high prices, the atmosphere and service were terrible. now, maybe my experience is different because i was here for a birthday get together with a big party but here are some of the things i encountered:it was HOT. the dining area was so hot that i was sweating the entire time. i was not outside or right next to the door but it was super hot.our waitress looked like she hated us right when we walked in. we couldn't find her so we asked the guy who is clearing our plate if we could get more water and another order of spin dip. when the waitress came back, she said that the guy we asked could not help us - he could only remove our plates. which is funny because he came back and confirmed that we talked to the waitress and brought us more water. they ran out of the spinach dip at 7pm on a Saturday night.my friend had a bug in her lemonade. the appetizer plates they gave us were dirty and not just one piece of dried food but the entire plate was covered with leftover food. and it took forever to get refills.we ordered burgers. a lot of people got the mac and cheese burger. when we ordered, she asked us how we wanted our burgers. it didn't matter because as the waitress explained, "since there were so many burger orders, the kitchen just cooked the burgers to whatever they could and sent it out." so i got a lovely, dry burger. but i ordered the classic burger that came with bacon, cheddar, lettuce, tomato, onions, mustard and mayo. i asked for no tomato or mustard. i got a burger without bacon and without mayo but WITH a tomato and cooked well done when i asked for medium. and the mac and cheese burger SOUNDS great but is overrated. it was just one thing after another with this place. it has the view and a nice looking inside but that's about it.

Came here for 4th of July before the fireworks with my fiancée and her sister. Sat at the bar over looking the beautiful view of the Hudson River and New York skyline. Food was superb. I had the burger with fries and the girls had a salad. Great food and amazing service!!! I am definitely coming back! Highly recommended!!!

My boyfriend and I came for brunch this morning and we both were very disappointed with the poor level of service and mediocre food. After being seated, it was 20 minutes before a server came over to greet us and to take our order. We ordered a Caesar salad to start and it was very bland and tasteless. Also, after we ordered, we overheard the people next to us ordering and when they asked for coffee, they were told that it would take 15 minutes or more for it to brew and that since people at other tables hadn't received coffee they ordered earlier, it would be unlikely that they too would receive coffee in a timely manner. No coffee at brunch?! Now that's a deal breaker if I ever heard one. The server was unaccommodating and appeared to care very little that his patrons weren't able to receive coffee with their brunch. To top it off, the coffee they ordered never arrived. When our entrees were finally brought over, after at least a 40 minute wait, the hanger steak burger and pork sandwich were both dry and lacking flavor. Our server never once came over to check in on us and ask if we needed anything. When we were finally tired of waiting for him to stop by, I had to make a great effort to flag him down to get the check. When this establishment was Little Town the service was efficient and the food never disappointed. My advice to the Ainsworth is if you would like to stay in business, the service is in desperate need of being revamped, with an emphasis on customer-centered service. I will definitely not return and would recommend that anyone considering this establishment that they instead go to one of Hoboken's many quality restaurants.
Stumbled upon this gem.  Great view of NYC in a chill/ upscale atmosphere. Great Ceasar salad, salmon dinner w/ broccoli & amazing burger & fries. Bustling & loud though.
Had the Mac and cheeseburger which was amazing. Could not even finish it. On Thursdays they have a special for $5 for all drafts.

WORSTSERVICE. Not worth the food. RUDE servers. Brought wrong food, extra drinks we didn't order (or drink) and charged us for all of it.  Pulled the "we are corporate" card and said they couldn't take the stuff off.  THEY SUCK!!!

I was very disappointed with my experience. Having disliked Little Town, I was eager to try the re-vamped site. 30 minutes after ordering our meals our waitress apologized and said it would be out any minute. 15 minutes later the manager arrived and said there was an issue in the kitchen and that our food would be out any minute. We ended up leaving because our food never arrived after 50 minutes. On a positive note, our waitress and the manager (John I believe) were very nice.

Their tuna tartar is to die for!! Great spot with an awesome ambience. Love the indoor/outdoor seating. The drinks are great and not too pricy. The staff is very friendly and attentive. Always come here with my girls for a relaxed type of night. And the city views are definitely a nice bonus.

Great service, our waitress was fantastic, the area and ambiance are great too. They get just 3 stars because the prices are too much for what you get. I don't mind paying the right price for food, this place just didn't justify it.
This place has so much potential but the service is horrible and the food is over priced.

I cannot get over the poor service! I've been here twice, once in the dining room and once at the bar. The first time I came here they forgot to bring the fries with my burger and the waitress said she would bring them right out. She never came back after that and I had to ask another server for help. No one ever checked on us once and I had to flag another person down just to get our check. I completely understand that servers get overwhelmed but this was just ridiculous. The bar was just as slow. We sat there for about 10 minutes without even being acknowledged and it wasn't crowded at all. Bartender finally came over just as we were about to walk out. Terrible service, I will not be back.

Dinner is pretty solid. I've gotten the ribeye twice and it works for the price. The staff does the trick as well but they drop the ball every now and then. We were disappointed with brunch but it's still a great option considering its in my building and they blow Little Town out of the water which was previously there.
A sports bar???? Came once for Sunday football TV  set  up is terrible food is pricey and odd  (tuna tartar and  oysters) not what I would order at a place like  this underwhelming and overpriced.

Tuna tar tar to die for. Mac n cheese burger to top it off was even better. John behind the bar was great made the perfect mojito. Also asked to try something new made a spicy margarita that was to die for!!!

I experienced great service at the bar when I was ordering drinks and food. BEST bartender I've seen in Hoboken, he gave me several samples of beer before I made my decision regarding which one I wanted... I will definitely be back for some beers, food and the incredible view of the NYC skyline.

I went there last night (New Years eve) with 4 friends and we paid extra money for a table, the burgers were rare and all three of the toilets were overflowing and out of toilet paper. A good restaurant would hire a bathroom attendant on NYE to prevent a wet bathroom that wasn't useable. I told the owner about the bathrooms and he said, the plumbing is bad.. Well would not recommend this place. It was dirty and a waste of money!
I've asked for a Bartenders Choice drink the two times I've been there... love it. Lol it did the trick

This place has the best food i ever tasted and Chris is an amazing host!  Get the buffalo chicken taco's and you won't be sorry.  Great atmosphere and a good place to watch the games and relax with a few drinks!

Came here the other night, had some drinks and tried the mac and cheese burger, which is awesome!  The bartender John (red) was fantastic.  Giselle was great as well but John really stood out.  Great time, great food, great service. I would definitely recommend this place, and I will be coming back.

Great addition to Hoboken. Stopped in the night after they had their Grand Opening to watch the ACC Tournament.  They had another party that night so they were full on reservations.  Still had room though at some high top tables.  Grabbed a spot there while I could and was glad I did since that section filled up quicklyThey were quick to help me out with the game I wanted to watch at the closest TV.  The rest of the place filled up quickly and was a lot of fun.  Good crowd and if you have been to either Ainsworth in the city I have to think you will be happy with this location as well.Food wise I only had the chance to have the Pork Tacos but those were great.  Definitely need to go again to check out the other food options.  Waitress, Julie, was great and service was fantastic.  Very busy night for them but she never missed a beat with keeping us going with drinks and food.  The only damper was UVA losing to UNC.

Food is quite good, especially the fish tacos and burgers, but overpriced as most restaurants on the waterfront typically are.  Their appetizer selection is pretty weak right now, they definitely need to work on that.  Friendly service and great views.

Last night we went to celebrate my birthday and I was not disappointed with my choice!! Our waitress Jennifer was so fun and fantastic. She really made the night perfect! We got the Ains Martini and the Mac&Cheeseburger which were both amazing. It was a great place for a celebration!
One of my favorite places in Hoboken, the Mac and cheese burger is delicious. Beautiful view and they allow dogs at their out door seating.
Fish tacos and buffalo tacos were delicious!    Great atmosphere, friendly crowd!   I'd return for food and cold beer...yum

The crowd is older (which I appreciate). The atmosphere is cool and the décor is trendy. The mac & cheese is to die for! I also LOOOVE the fish tacos. Don't ask to special order anything though because the answer is always no. (Not cool for people with dietary restrictions.) I don't love the stemless martini and wine glasses. Makes the drinks warm since your hand touches the glass vs. the stem. But, what do I know. The menu isn't cheap but I suppose they have to pay rent, as their waterfront location with views of Manhattan is definitely desirable.

I have to preface this review with the fact that our meal was free as a direct result of the service, and they ran out of Coors Lite... That said, I can get started. Oh also, i write long reviews, deal.Came with some friends to catch the Ranger/Penguin's game, to have a few drinks as well as dinner. They told my friend who called earlier in the day that they weren't taking reservation but we could come early to put our names down and try to nab a table - in addition, they put us down for a 9 PM reservation which was confusing since I thought they weren't taking them?Anyway..We got there around 7:30 checked in, added our name to the "list" in case any tables opened, and grabbed some drinks from the bar. Approximately 14 tables in the restaurant were open. We were able to stand outside and drink and get drinks from the bar without a problem. Despite there being open tables throughout the space, we didn't sit until our 9 PM reservation rolled around... That's when the problems started. We sat down and we were greeted by a waitress asking what type of water we wanted. We told her tap was fine and she scampered off to tell a bus boy and said she'd be back to take our drink order. Fifteen minutes go by. No water. No drink order. She finally returns, appalled our water hasn't come out yet and runs away to get us water. Eventually she takes our order, we order drinks, apps and our meals all at the same time. Approximately 10 minutes later she comes back with our drinks and informs us they are out of Coors Light, which someone in our party ordered. We asked for a drink so an alternative can be picked.
